body_html:
No operation that takes a single tensor, but to which you provide a list, is an identity operation.

The fact that this didn't raise an error is a little bit unfortunate; but the automatic merging of lists when a single tensor is expected is very useful in almost all other contexts.

We could certainly add an error check of the form:
if x is a flat list and x has Tensors in it, raise error
in tf.Print, tf.identity, and tf.placeholder_with_default (specifically because folks expect it to work as identity); though this may be considered an API breakage. @josh11b wdyt?

body:
No operation that takes a single tensor, but to which you provide a list, is an identity operation.

The fact that this didn't raise an error is a little bit unfortunate; but the automatic merging of lists when a single tensor is expected is very useful in almost all other contexts.

We could certainly add an error check of the form:
```if x is a flat list and x has Tensors in it, raise error```
in tf.Print, tf.identity, and tf.placeholder_with_default (specifically because folks expect it to work as identity); though this may be considered an API breakage.  @josh11b wdyt?
